results.title: Destination Point
results.creator_credit: Argyle Primary School, Bloom Productions and First Light
results.brief_description: Year 5 Primary school pupils from Kings Cross explore the ethnic diversity of their area and school. Kings Cross is an international destination point. Thousands of people travel in and out of the station every day. Some are travelling through on their way to somewhere else, some come into work and others travel to Kings Cross and make it home.

results.title: Until My Heart's, Like, Finished
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Martin Hodgson, Phil Shepherd, First Light and Somerset Film
results.brief_description: On the day of your 16th birthday, your mum kicks you out of home for good. You live in a car. You sofa surf. You sleep rough. Life for these young people has been tough with many challenges. Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.

results.title: Prehistoric Pet Shop
results.creator_credit: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.brief_description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. A homage to Monty Python’s parrot sketch, this hilarious short reveals that complaining can get you more than just a new alarm clock.

results.title: Olympic Legacy: this was forever
results.creator_credit: Mark Aitken, First Light and Polkadotsonraindrops
results.brief_description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

results.title: My Grandma
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Taylor, First Light, Smith and Watson Productions and Wide Eyed
results.brief_description: Jamie is a girl who just wants to enjoy herself. However, she is constantly called upon to care for her demanding Grandmother. She is tired of hearing tales of Grandma’s childhood whilst missing out on her own. Successfully demonstrating the difference between two generations of women, will her Grandma’s constant nagging and complaining push Jamie too far?

results.title: One Week Later
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Rachel Tunnard, Mandy Rathbone, Ferndown Upper School, First Light and PVA Medialab
results.brief_description: Told through the eyes of a younger pupil, who surveys the relationships his brother has with his peer group. As revelations and misunderstandings occur, due to the misuse of the ubiquitous mobile phone, the week’s events come to a climax on a Friday afternoon.

results.title: Beloved
results.creator_credit: Daniel Zinkant, Elle Farnham, First Light and Suited & Booted Studios
results.brief_description: Through the main protagonist Dave, we hear and see what it is like to be in love and have those feelings trapped inside. As we are let into Dave’s world, we see him and a group of friends as they leave school and embark on their journey home. The film flicks between two worlds of fantasy and real-life as the journey progresses. As the narrative comes to an end, we watch the three friends depart and Dave is left alone. His love unknown, unsaid but only understood by the viewer.

results.title: Vitaphone Disc: Columbia Pictures Corporation, "Wall Street", CP- B37 Reel Six, Times Played 1
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.
results.title_for_label: Vitaphone Disc: Columbia Pictures Corporation, “Wall Street”, CP- B37 Reel Six, Times Played 1

results.title: Hollywood Costume. Inside the wardrobe: panel discussion
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh, Sam Mapplebeck and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume. Inside the wardrobe: panel discussion

results.brief_description:
This panel discussion explores the collaborative process between film director and costume designer, the link between costume and character and how costumes connect audiences with on-screen worlds. It also focuses on the artistic role of costuming in the filmmaking process.

Hear from leaders in costuming, film and fashion, the influential Australian film and television costumers Edie Kurzer (‘South Solitary’, ‘Look Both Ways’, ‘Matching Jack’) Cappi Ireland (‘I Frankenstein’, ‘Animal Kingdom’, ‘The Slap’) and Anna Borghesi (‘Mao’s Last Dancer’, ‘Ned Kelly’ ,’Romper Stomper’) in a discussion chaired by NIDA’s Head of Costume, Fiona Reilly.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Deborah Nadoolman Landis interview
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Sam Mapplebeck and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume: Deborah Nadoolman Landis interview

results.brief_description:
Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis, an Oscar nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning catalogue for the exhibition, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes. Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.
In this interview she talks about the origins of the Hollywood Costume industry, working as a costume designer, what a costume designer does and the relationship between the director and the costume designer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Sam Mapplebeck and ACMI
